DC2013_Chap05

Multiple Choice
Identify the choice that best completes the statement or answers the question.
 

 1. 
What is the definition of a program?
a.
a collection of unprocessed text, numbers, images, audio, and video
b.
a series of related instructions that tells a computer what to do and how to do it
c.
an instruction issued by replying to a question that is displayed
d.
an instruction that causes a single specific action to be performed
 

 2. 
Which of the following kinds of keyboard has a design that reduces the chance of wrist and hand injuries?
a.
basal
b.
enhanced
c.
strength-building
d.
ergonomic
 

 3. 
Similar to a mechanical mouse that has a ball on the bottom, a particular kind of stationary pointing device has a ball on its top or side. What kind of pointing device is this?
a.
trackball
b.
touchpad
c.
optical mouse
d.
stylus
 
 
 

 4. 
Which of the following is a more affordable and lightweight version of the technology shown in the accompanying figure and provides acceptable photographic images for the home or small business user?
a.
studio camera
b.
plug-and-play camera
c.
field camera
d.
point-and-shoot camera
 

 5. 
What term refers to the process of entering input by speaking into a microphone?
a.
voice matter
b.
voice input
c.
voice output
d.
voice outreach
 

 6. 
Which of the following is a type of digital video camera that enables a home or small business user to capture video and still images, send e-mail messages with video attachments, add live images to instant messages, broadcast live images over the Internet, and make video telephone calls?
a.
online cam
b.
Web cam
c.
conference cam
d.
video cam
 

 7. 
Which of the following kinds of scanners works in a manner similar to a copy machine except it creates a file of the document in memory instead of a paper copy?
a.
drum
b.
baseline
c.
roller
d.
flatbed
 

 8. 
Which of the following is an identification code that consists of a set of vertical lines and spaces of different widths?
a.
RFID
b.
OCR
c.
bar code
d.
turnaround
 

 9. 
Which of the following is used almost exclusively by the banking industry for check processing?
a.
MICR
b.
OCR
c.
MIDI
d.
OCM
 

 10. 
Which of the following kinds of identifier is a physiological or behavioral characteristic such as fingerprints, hand geometry, facial features, voice, signatures, and eye patterns?
a.
personal
b.
biometric
c.
indexed
d.
basal
 
 
COGNITIVE ASSESSMENT
 

 11. 
If your instructor advises you to use the keys at the top of your keyboard that are identified by the letter F and then a number to perform certain activities, what kind of keys is she advising you to use?
a.
facillitating keys
b.
function keys
c.
feature keys
d.
finger keys
 

 12. 
When your sister goes to work, what scientific discipline is used in the design of her workplace to incorporate comfort, efficiency, and safety for her?
a.
human entimyology
b.
factoronomics
c.
form technics
d.
ergonomics
 

 13. 
Which mobile device feature can save time for users when entering text using a phone’s keypad?
a.
textSpeed
b.
text AutoFill
c.
predictive text input
d.
intelligent text input
 

 14. 
Which of the following identifies pointing devices that can be used instead of a mouse?
a.
trackball, touchpad, pointing stick
b.
pointing pin, trackpad, mouseball
c.
clickpad, finger roll, mousetrack
d.
trackball, pointing stick, thumbpad
 

 15. 
When a photographer decides to purchase a digital camera, what are the three basic types of cameras from which he can choose?
a.
point-and-shoot camera, studio camera, field camera
b.
SLR camera, point-and-shoot camera, stabilized platform camera
c.
field camera, indoor camera, stationary camera
d.
removable lens camera, studio camera, high-resolution camera
 

 16. 
What is the difference between optical resolution and enhanced resolution?
a.
There is no difference.
b.
Optical resolution is the resolution obtained when the special optics on certain cameras are used to record the image, and enhanced resolution is the result of software correcting and enhancing an image.
c.
Optical resolution is the resolution of an image seen with the naked eye, and enhanced resolution is the resolution of an image seen with optics that enhance the image.
d.
Optical resolution is the actual photographed resolution of a camera, and enhanced resolution is the resolution after additional pixels have been added to those generated by optical resolution.
 

 17. 
Which type of optical scanner works in a manner similar to a copy machine?
a.
pen scanner
b.
sheet-fed scanner
c.
flatbed scanner
d.
drum scanner
 

 18. 
What type of device reads the strip of magnetic material on the back of your father’s credit card?
a.
credit card reader
b.
magReader
c.
magnetic stripe card reader
d.
MCR
 

 19. 
Which industry almost exclusively uses MICR?
a.
banking
b.
retail
c.
automobile manufacturing
d.
air transportation
 

 20. 
What act addresses the computing and other requirements of individuals in the workplace who have or may develop physical limitations?
a.
Physical Limitations Act
b.
Computer Assistance Act
c.
Americans with Disabilities Act
d.
American Support Act
 

True/False
Indicate whether the statement is true or false.
 

 1. 
An input device is any hardware component that allows users to enter data or instructions (programs, commands, and user responses) into a computer.
 

 2. 
Employees can be injured or develop disorders of the muscles, nerves, tendons, ligaments, and joints from working in an area that is not designed ergonomically.
 

 3. 
The function of the mouse buttons and the wheel varies depending on the program.
 

 4. 
The mouse is the most widely used pointing device today.
 

 5. 
To capture a handwritten signature, a user writes his or her name on a signature capture pad with a stylus or pen that is attached to the device.
 

 6. 
Enhanced resolution usually is lower than optical resolution because it uses a special formula to add pixels between those generated by the optical resolution.
 

 7. 
OCR software is useful if a user needs to modify a document, but does not have the original word processing file.
 

 8. 
Exposure to a magnet or magnetic field can erase the contents of a card’s magnetic stripe.
 

 9. 
External fingerprint readers usually plug into a USB port.
 

 10. 
A DVD kiosk is associated with a particular vendor.
